p: Climate change and health vulnerability and adaptation assessments (V&As) are an important instrument and process to establish partnerships and obtain information for understanding and addressing climate change-related risks [ 8]. They can also provide the knowledge needed to realize potentially large health co-benefits from well-designed adaptation and greenhouse gas mitigation measures, thereby taking advantage of what the Lancet Commission on Climate and Health suggests is the “…greatest global health opportunity of the 21st century” [ 5] (p. 1).
